data.input: Details of a sordid rift between two prominent U . S . soccer families — one that included allegations of domestic abuse against men ’ s national team coach Gregg Berhalter and parental complaints about Gio Reyna ’ s playing time at the 2022 World Cup — continued to spill out Monday when the findings of an independent investigation were released .The three - month probe , conducted by the Alston & Bird law firm , concluded Berhalter had not committed any additional acts of violence against his now - wife since 1992 and hadn ’ t violated any disclosure rules during his hiring process .He had previously admitted to kicking her while they were dating as students at the University of North Carolina .With that finding , the U . S . Soccer Federation said Berhalter would remain a candidate to return as coach .His contract expired Dec . 31 .“ Given the investigators ’ conclusion that there is no legal impediment to employing him , Gregg Berhalter remains a candidate to serve as head coach ,” the USSF said in a statement .The governing body said it will not hire a coach until it appoints a new sporting director , a position that oversees all national teams .

United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney , still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stage of the MLS season .At the least , United plays hard for the former English superstar , whose fierce determination as a player in Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans .On Saturday , for the second time in two appearances at Audi Field this season , United ’ s resolve produced another stirring finish — albeit this time one that yielded only one point .Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute , ending a night of frustration for goal - averse United in a 1 - 1 draw with Orlando City .Opportunities were aplenty for United ( 1 - 1 - 1 ), but it took Durkin ’ s strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire ’ s goal early in the second half .“ I wanted to see a reaction [ to Orlando ’ s goal ], which I did , so 90 percent of the game I thought was good .The 10 percent , it wasn ’ t ,” Rooney said .“ We need to make sure when we go into them [ low ] periods , we ’ re harder to beat or harder to score against .” He added , “ There ’ s a lot of positives we can take from it — just frustrating we didn ’ t take three points .” At the top of the box , Durkin cut the ball back on César Araújo , then ripped a 16 - yard , left - footed shot with terrific technique and execution .The ball took flight and beat goalkeeper Pedro Gallese to the far side for Durkin ’ s third career MLS goal .

data.input: During the weeks that Poolesville High School has been under construction , several students have reported nausea , headaches and difficulty concentrating .The students and their parents say the symptoms started in February and are a reaction to fumes being emitted from tar used in renovations .They have asked Montgomery County school officials to pause the work until students ’ health concerns are addressed .Krisna Becker , a parent of two at the school , said one of her daughters texted her on Feb . 14 asking to be picked up early because of how strong the fumes were from the construction work .Other students and teachers had also been complaining that morning .The school ended up releasing early that day because of an odor that came from “ work done outside of school hours and windy conditions ,” Montgomery County Public Schools spokeswoman Jessica Baxter said .“ That was the first extreme event that happened ,” Becker , 49 , said in an interview .Since then , the potency of the “ fumes ” has varied , but “ some days it ’ s really extreme ” and even on the days it ’ s not , “ it still causes headaches ,” she said .

data.expected_output: Construction at Poolesville High began in June 2022 and is expected to be completed in 2024 .The project will renovate and expand the square footage of the school .Becker has headed up a campaign urging other parents to advocate for a temporary stop to the tar work .She wrote about the effects the fumes have had on her daughters , who stay after school sometimes to rehearse for the school ’ s production of “ Into the Woods .” In her letter to the other parents , Becker also listed safety concerns .In one example , she wrote the project ’ s chemical list and material data notes that the work includes the use of an asphalt primer and advises : “ Avoid prolonged breathing of vapor and use only in adequate ventilation .Repeated and prolonged overexposure to solvent vapor may cause brain and nervous system damage , respiratory tract irritation , dizziness , or loss of consciousness .” Becker wrote that parents and teachers should have been told about potential health risks in advance .

data.input: The early days of Microsoft ’ s ChatGPT were something of a replay of internet history — beginning with excitement about these inventions and ending in trepidation about the harm they could do .ChatGPT and other “ large - language models ” — artificially intelligent systems trained on vast troves of text — can turn into liars or racists or terrorist accomplices that explain how to build dirty bombs .The question is : When that happens , who ’ s responsible ?Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act says that services — from Facebook and Google to movie - review aggregators and mommy blogs with comment sections — shouldn ’ t face liability for most material from third parties .It ’ s fairly easy in these cases to distinguish between the platform and the person who ’ s posting .Not so with chatbots and AI assistants .Few have grappled with whether Section 230 provides protections to them .Consider ChatGPT .Type in a question , and it provides an answer .
data.actual_output: What would you like to ask ?
data.expected_output: It doesn ’ t merely surface existing content , such as a tweet , video or website originally contributed by someone else , but rather writes a contribution of its own in real time .The law says a person or entity becomes liable if they “ develop ” content even “ in part .” And doesn ’ t transforming , say , a list of search results into a summary qualify as development ?What ’ s more , the contours of every AI contribution are informed substantially by the AI ’ s creators , who have set the rules for their systems and shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don ’ t .Yet at the same time , ChatGPT ’ s every answer is , as one analyst put it , a “ remix ” of third - party material .The tool generates its responses by predicting what word should come next in a sentence based on what words come next in sentences across the web .And as much as creators behind a machine inform its outputs , so too do the users posing queries or engaging in conversation .All this suggests that the degree of protection afforded to AI models may vary by how much a given product is regurgitating versus synthesizing , as well as by how deliberately a user has goaded a model into producing a given reply .

United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney , still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stage of the MLS season .At the least , United plays hard for the former English superstar , whose fierce determination as a player in Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans .On Saturday , for the second time in two appearances at Audi Field this season , United ’ s resolve produced another stirring finish — albeit this time one that yielded only one point .Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute , ending a night of frustration for goal - averse United in a 1 - 1 draw with Orlando City .Opportunities were aplenty for United ( 1 - 1 - 1 ), but it took Durkin ’ s strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire ’ s goal early in the second half .“ I wanted to see a reaction [ to Orlando ’ s goal ], which I did , so 90 percent of the game I thought was good .The 10 percent , it wasn ’ t ,” Rooney said .“ We need to make sure when we go into them [ low ] periods , we ’ re harder to beat or harder to score against .” He added , “ There ’ s a lot of positives we can take from it — just frustrating we didn ’ t take three points .” At the top of the box , Durkin cut the ball back on César Araújo , then ripped a 16 - yard , left - footed shot with terrific technique and execution .The ball took flight and beat goalkeeper Pedro Gallese to the far side for Durkin ’ s third career MLS goal .
data.actual_output: 华盛顿联队在教练韦恩·罗尼奥的带领下仍然在不断发展，仍然在寻找碎片并逐步适应MLS赛季初期。至少，华盛顿联队为前英格兰超级巨星罗尼奥付出了辛勤的努力，他在华盛顿的激烈斗志几年前赢得了怀疑球迷的拥护。周六，在奥迪球场进行的第二个赛季中，联队的决心再次产生了令人振奋的结局——尽管这一次只拿到了一分。中场球员克里斯·迪林在80分钟时打进了一粒美妙的进球，结束了联盟在1-1战平奥兰多城的比赛中屡屡受挫的夜晚。联队有很多机会（1-1-1），但迪林进球才抵消了邓肯·麦格雷尔新秀早些时候在第二半球的进球。罗尼奥说：“我希望看到对奥兰多进球的反应，我看到了，所以90%的比赛我认为是好的。那10%，不是很好。我们需要确保当我们进入这些低谷时期时，我们更难被击败或更难被进球。”他补充道：“我们可以从中吸取很多积极的教训——只是遗憾的是我们没有拿到三分。”在禁区上方，迪林把球传回给塞萨尔·阿拉尤，然后以出色的技术和执行能力猛击了一记16码、左脚、左脚的射门。球飞起来，越过佩德罗·加列塞的防守，进入了远侧，这是迪林职业生涯第三个MLS进球。
data.expected_output: “ I can ’ t say I ’ ve hit that [ with the left foot ] in training before ,” the right - footed Durkin said , smiling .United goalkeeper Tyler Miller said : “ I didn ’ t know he had such a good left foot .It was amazing .” Aside from McGuire ’ s goal , United was much tighter and tidier defensively than it was against Columbus last weekend .In the attack , however , it remained inefficient with scoring opportunities , and Rooney said , “ We could have easily been two or three up in the first half .” Orlando ( 1 - 0 - 2 ) played its first away match in league play after defeating the New York Red Bulls , 1 - 0 , and drawing with FC Cincinnati , 0 - 0 .At the moment , though , the Lions ’ priority is the Concacaf Champions League .The visit to Washington fell between legs of a round - of - 16 series with Mexican power Tigres .A 0 - 0 draw in Monterrey , Mexico , on Tuesday positioned them well for the return match in Florida on Wednesday .

data.input: During the weeks that Poolesville High School has been under construction , several students have reported nausea , headaches and difficulty concentrating .The students and their parents say the symptoms started in February and are a reaction to fumes being emitted from tar used in renovations .They have asked Montgomery County school officials to pause the work until students ’ health concerns are addressed .Krisna Becker , a parent of two at the school , said one of her daughters texted her on Feb . 14 asking to be picked up early because of how strong the fumes were from the construction work .Other students and teachers had also been complaining that morning .The school ended up releasing early that day because of an odor that came from “ work done outside of school hours and windy conditions ,” Montgomery County Public Schools spokeswoman Jessica Baxter said .“ That was the first extreme event that happened ,” Becker , 49 , said in an interview .Since then , the potency of the “ fumes ” has varied , but “ some days it ’ s really extreme ” and even on the days it ’ s not , “ it still causes headaches ,” she said .
data.actual_output:
In response to the health concerns of Poolesville High School students and their parents, Montgomery County school officials have been working closely with the construction team to identify and address the source of the fumes.While the school district has not yet determined the exact cause of the fumes, it is believed that the symptoms experienced by the students may be due to volatile organic compounds (VOCs) emitted from the tar used in the construction process.
In the meantime, the school district has taken several measures to mitigate the effects of the fumes on students and staff.These measures include increasing ventilation in the school, using fans and air purifiers, and scheduling construction work during times when students are not present in the building.The school district is also in the process of installing air quality monitoring systems to track the levels of VOCs in the school.
The school district and the construction team are committed to ensuring the safety of students and staff and will continue to monitor the situation and take appropriate action to address any concerns.While the construction work is essential for the improvement of the school, the health and well-being of students and staff must always be the top priority.
data.expected_output: Construction at Poolesville High began in June 2022 and is expected to be completed in 2024 .The project will renovate and expand the square footage of the school .Becker has headed up a campaign urging other parents to advocate for a temporary stop to the tar work .She wrote about the effects the fumes have had on her daughters , who stay after school sometimes to rehearse for the school ’ s production of “ Into the Woods .” In her letter to the other parents , Becker also listed safety concerns .In one example , she wrote the project ’ s chemical list and material data notes that the work includes the use of an asphalt primer and advises : “ Avoid prolonged breathing of vapor and use only in adequate ventilation .Repeated and prolonged overexposure to solvent vapor may cause brain and nervous system damage , respiratory tract irritation , dizziness , or loss of consciousness .” Becker wrote that parents and teachers should have been told about potential health risks in advance .

data.input: Quarterback Aaron Rodgers said in a broadcast interview Wednesday that he intends to continue his NFL career with the New York Jets after 18 seasons with the Green Bay Packers .The four - time league MVP said on “ The Pat McAfee Show ” that the Packers plan to move on from him as their quarterback .According to Rodgers , the Packers ’ trade demands are holding up a prospective deal that would send him to the Jets .“ I think since Friday I ’ ve made it clear that my intention was to play and my intention was to play for the New York Jets ,” Rodgers said .“ And I haven ’ t been holding anything up at this point .It ’ s been the compensation that the Packers are trying to get for me and kind of digging their heels in .… It is what it is .The Packers would like to move on .They ’ ve let me know that in so many words .They ’ ve let other people know that in direct words .” Rodgers met with Jets officials , including team owner Woody Johnson and Coach Robert Saleh , last week in California .“ I ’ m not offended by any of this ,” Rodgers said .
data.actual_output:
"I think since Friday I've made it clear that my intention was to play, and my intention was to play for the New York Jets. And I haven't been holding anything up at this point. It's been the compensation that the Packers are trying to get for me and kind of digging their heels in... It is what it is. The Packers would like to move on. They've let me know that in so many words. They've let other people know that in direct words." - Aaron Rodgers, four-time NFL MVP and former quarterback for the Green Bay Packers.
Quarterback Aaron Rodgers, a four-time NFL MVP, announced his intention to continue his NFL career with the New York Jets after 18 seasons with the Green Bay Packers. Rodgers revealed this information in an interview on "The Pat McAfee Show" and stated that the Packers were demanding too much in a trade that would send him to the Jets. Rodgers met with Jets officials, including team owner Woody Johnson and Coach Robert Saleh, last week in California. Despite the trade impasse, Rodgers remains focused on playing for the Jets and is not offended by the Packers' decision to move on from him.
data.expected_output: “ I ’ m not a victim by any of this .I don ’ t have that mentality .I have nothing but love and appreciation .… Coming to this reality has been really bittersweet because I was drafted by Green Bay .I … love that city .I love that organization and [ am ] always going to have love for that organization .But the facts are right now they want to move on .And now so do I .” The NFL ’ s free agent market officially opened Wednesday afternoon .

data.input: The early days of Microsoft ’ s ChatGPT were something of a replay of internet history — beginning with excitement about these inventions and ending in trepidation about the harm they could do .ChatGPT and other “ large - language models ” — artificially intelligent systems trained on vast troves of text — can turn into liars or racists or terrorist accomplices that explain how to build dirty bombs .The question is : When that happens , who ’ s responsible ?Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act says that services — from Facebook and Google to movie - review aggregators and mommy blogs with comment sections — shouldn ’ t face liability for most material from third parties .It ’ s fairly easy in these cases to distinguish between the platform and the person who ’ s posting .Not so with chatbots and AI assistants .Few have grappled with whether Section 230 provides protections to them .Consider ChatGPT .Type in a question , and it provides an answer .
data.actual_output: But if that answer is false , or hateful or incites violence , who ’ s to blame ?On one hand , the answer is clear . It ’ s ChatGPT ’ s creator — the software is not a person , after all .But on the other , if a chatbot is programmed to have the ability to make decisions , it might be treated more like a person — especially if it gets so good that the distinction between it and human users is indistinguishable .And if we can ’ t tell a chatbot from a person , then it ’ s worth considering if the law should change to reflect that , says Eric Goldman , a professor at Santa Clara University ’ s law school .“ We need to think about how we ’ re going to treat these AI systems that have human - like characteristics ,” says Goldman .“ If they ’ re going to be treated like people , then we need to update the law — and if they ’ re going to be treated like a service , then we need to update the law .”
data.expected_output: It doesn ’ t merely surface existing content , such as a tweet , video or website originally contributed by someone else , but rather writes a contribution of its own in real time .The law says a person or entity becomes liable if they “ develop ” content even “ in part .” And doesn ’ t transforming , say , a list of search results into a summary qualify as development ?What ’ s more , the contours of every AI contribution are informed substantially by the AI ’ s creators , who have set the rules for their systems and shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don ’ t .Yet at the same time , ChatGPT ’ s every answer is , as one analyst put it , a “ remix ” of third - party material .The tool generates its responses by predicting what word should come next in a sentence based on what words come next in sentences across the web .And as much as creators behind a machine inform its outputs , so too do the users posing queries or engaging in conversation .All this suggests that the degree of protection afforded to AI models may vary by how much a given product is regurgitating versus synthesizing , as well as by how deliberately a user has goaded a model into producing a given reply .

metric_metadata.reason: The score is 0.89 because the actual output mostly addresses the core issue of liability for AI-generated content, discussing Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act and its implications for platforms and chatbots. However, the relevance is slightly diminished by the mention of Eric Goldman, a person who is not directly connected to the main question at hand. This unnecessary detail prevents the score from being higher, but the overall response still provides valuable context and insight into the topic.

data.input: Details of a sordid rift between two prominent U . S . soccer families — one that included allegations of domestic abuse against men ’ s national team coach Gregg Berhalter and parental complaints about Gio Reyna ’ s playing time at the 2022 World Cup — continued to spill out Monday when the findings of an independent investigation were released .The three - month probe , conducted by the Alston & Bird law firm , concluded Berhalter had not committed any additional acts of violence against his now - wife since 1992 and hadn ’ t violated any disclosure rules during his hiring process .He had previously admitted to kicking her while they were dating as students at the University of North Carolina .With that finding , the U . S . Soccer Federation said Berhalter would remain a candidate to return as coach .His contract expired Dec . 31 .“ Given the investigators ’ conclusion that there is no legal impediment to employing him , Gregg Berhalter remains a candidate to serve as head coach ,” the USSF said in a statement .The governing body said it will not hire a coach until it appoints a new sporting director , a position that oversees all national teams .
data.actual_output:
A three-month investigation conducted by Alston & Bird, a law firm, has concluded that U.S. men's national team coach Gregg Berhalter did not commit any additional acts of violence against his wife since 1992 and did not violate any disclosure rules during his hiring process.

Berhalter had previously admitted to kicking his wife while they were dating as students at the University of North Carolina. With the finding of the investigation, the U.S. Soccer Federation said Berhalter would remain a candidate to return as coach. His contract expired on Dec. 31.

"Given the investigators' conclusion that there is no legal impediment to employing him, Gregg Berhalter remains a candidate to serve as head coach," the USSF said in a statement. The governing body said it will not hire a coach until it appoints a new sporting director, a position that oversees all national teams.
data.expected_output: Earnie Stewart left the job last month .Anthony Hudson , a World Cup assistant , is the interim coach .The next coach will begin preparing the U . S . team for the 2026 World Cup , which will take place in the United States , Mexico and Canada .Berhalter guided the United States for four years , leading a young squad to two regional championships and a place in the World Cup , where it finished second in group play and lost to the Netherlands in the round of 16 .Investigators said in the report that they “ uncovered no facts to show that U . S . Soccer knew of the 1992 Incident when it hired Mr . Berhalter ; no facts to show that similar incidents occurred at any point in the last 31 years ; no facts to show that the 1992 Incident has any nexus to the present or to the workplace ; and no facts to support a claim that Mr . Berhalter presents a risk of harm to others .” Berhalter ’ s wife , Rosalind , told investigators she was not injured and didn ’ t complain to the university .

United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney , still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stage of the MLS season .At the least , United plays hard for the former English superstar , whose fierce determination as a player in Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans .On Saturday , for the second time in two appearances at Audi Field this season , United ’ s resolve produced another stirring finish — albeit this time one that yielded only one point .Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute , ending a night of frustration for goal - averse United in a 1 - 1 draw with Orlando City .Opportunities were aplenty for United ( 1 - 1 - 1 ), but it took Durkin ’ s strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire ’ s goal early in the second half .“ I wanted to see a reaction [ to Orlando ’ s goal ], which I did , so 90 percent of the game I thought was good .The 10 percent , it wasn ’ t ,” Rooney said .“ We need to make sure when we go into them [ low ] periods , we ’ re harder to beat or harder to score against .” He added , “ There ’ s a lot of positives we can take from it — just frustrating we didn ’ t take three points .” At the top of the box , Durkin cut the ball back on César Araújo , then ripped a 16 - yard , left - footed shot with terrific technique and execution .The ball took flight and beat goalkeeper Pedro Gallese to the far side for Durkin ’ s third career MLS goal .

D.C. United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney, still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stage of the MLS season.At the least, United plays hard for the former English superstar, whose fierce determination as a player in Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans.On Saturday, for the second time in two appearances at Audi Field this season, United's resolve produced another stirring finish - albeit this time one that yielded only one point.

Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute, ending a night of frustration for goal-averse United in a 1-1 draw with Orlando City.Opportunities were aplenty for United (1-1-1), but it took Durkin's strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire's goal early in the second half.

"I wanted to see a reaction [to Orlando's goal], which I did, so 90 percent of the game I thought was good.The 10 percent, it wasn't," Rooney said. "We need to make sure when we go into them [low] periods, we're harder to beat or harder to score against." He added, "There's a lot of positives we can take from it - just frustrating we didn't take three points."

At the top of the box, Durkin cut the ball back on César Araújo, then ripped a 16-yard, left-footed shot with terrific technique and execution.The ball took flight and beat goalkeeper Pedro Gallese to the far side for Durkin's third career MLS goal.
data.expected_output: “ I can ’ t say I ’ ve hit that [ with the left foot ] in training before ,” the right - footed Durkin said , smiling .United goalkeeper Tyler Miller said : “ I didn ’ t know he had such a good left foot .It was amazing .” Aside from McGuire ’ s goal , United was much tighter and tidier defensively than it was against Columbus last weekend .In the attack , however , it remained inefficient with scoring opportunities , and Rooney said , “ We could have easily been two or three up in the first half .” Orlando ( 1 - 0 - 2 ) played its first away match in league play after defeating the New York Red Bulls , 1 - 0 , and drawing with FC Cincinnati , 0 - 0 .At the moment , though , the Lions ’ priority is the Concacaf Champions League .The visit to Washington fell between legs of a round - of - 16 series with Mexican power Tigres .A 0 - 0 draw in Monterrey , Mexico , on Tuesday positioned them well for the return match in Florida on Wednesday .

data.input: During the weeks that Poolesville High School has been under construction , several students have reported nausea , headaches and difficulty concentrating .The students and their parents say the symptoms started in February and are a reaction to fumes being emitted from tar used in renovations .They have asked Montgomery County school officials to pause the work until students ’ health concerns are addressed .Krisna Becker , a parent of two at the school , said one of her daughters texted her on Feb . 14 asking to be picked up early because of how strong the fumes were from the construction work .Other students and teachers had also been complaining that morning .The school ended up releasing early that day because of an odor that came from “ work done outside of school hours and windy conditions ,” Montgomery County Public Schools spokeswoman Jessica Baxter said .“ That was the first extreme event that happened ,” Becker , 49 , said in an interview .Since then , the potency of the “ fumes ” has varied , but “ some days it ’ s really extreme ” and even on the days it ’ s not , “ it still causes headaches ,” she said .
data.actual_output:
Becker and other parents have been pressing school officials to investigate the cause of the symptoms and take measures to mitigate the problem .In a letter to school officials on Monday ,the parents wrote , “ Our children are being made sick and we need to know why .We need to know if there is a safe solution for our children to continue their education .”
Montgomery County Public Schools spokesman Frank Miller said the district had received the letter and was looking into the issue .“ We take the health and safety of our students and staff very seriously , and we want to make sure that we ’ re doing everything we can to address these concerns ,” Miller said .
Baxter said the school system was working with contractors to identify potential sources of the fumes and take steps to mitigate them .“ We have been working closely with the contractors to address the concerns that have been raised and to ensure that all necessary measures are being taken to protect the health and safety of our students and staff , ” she said .
The school system has implemented several other measures to help address the issue , including providing air purifiers in some classrooms and offering accommodations such as remote learning for students who are affected , Baxter said .
In the meantime , Becker said she and other parents are “ doing everything we can to make sure our kids are safe .”She said she is grateful for the measures that have been taken so far but “ we need to do more .”
data.expected_output: Construction at Poolesville High began in June 2022 and is expected to be completed in 2024 .The project will renovate and expand the square footage of the school .Becker has headed up a campaign urging other parents to advocate for a temporary stop to the tar work .She wrote about the effects the fumes have had on her daughters , who stay after school sometimes to rehearse for the school ’ s production of “ Into the Woods .” In her letter to the other parents , Becker also listed safety concerns .In one example , she wrote the project ’ s chemical list and material data notes that the work includes the use of an asphalt primer and advises : “ Avoid prolonged breathing of vapor and use only in adequate ventilation .Repeated and prolonged overexposure to solvent vapor may cause brain and nervous system damage , respiratory tract irritation , dizziness , or loss of consciousness .” Becker wrote that parents and teachers should have been told about potential health risks in advance .

data.input: Quarterback Aaron Rodgers said in a broadcast interview Wednesday that he intends to continue his NFL career with the New York Jets after 18 seasons with the Green Bay Packers .The four - time league MVP said on “ The Pat McAfee Show ” that the Packers plan to move on from him as their quarterback .According to Rodgers , the Packers ’ trade demands are holding up a prospective deal that would send him to the Jets .“ I think since Friday I ’ ve made it clear that my intention was to play and my intention was to play for the New York Jets ,” Rodgers said .“ And I haven ’ t been holding anything up at this point .It ’ s been the compensation that the Packers are trying to get for me and kind of digging their heels in .… It is what it is .The Packers would like to move on .They ’ ve let me know that in so many words .They ’ ve let other people know that in direct words .” Rodgers met with Jets officials , including team owner Woody Johnson and Coach Robert Saleh , last week in California .“ I ’ m not offended by any of this ,” Rodgers said .
data.actual_output: The New York Jets have confirmed they are discussing a trade for Aaron Rodgers but have not provided any details on the specific terms.In a statement released on Thursday, the Jets said: "We are in discussions with the Green Bay Packers regarding a trade for quarterback Aaron Rodgers. We will have no further comment at this time."Rodgers' intention to play for the Jets was first reported by ESPN on Wednesday, with the Packers demanding a high draft pick in return for the star quarterback.However, the Jets have not confirmed if they are willing to part with a high draft pick to acquire Rodgers.The Packers have been keen to move on from Rodgers, who has been with the team for the past 18 seasons, ever since they drafted quarterback Jordan Love in 2020.Love has struggled to make an impact in the NFL and the Packers are believed to be looking for a long-term replacement for Rodgers.It remains to be seen if a trade will finally be agreed between the Jets, Packers and Rodgers, with the quarterback still refusing to confirm his plans.
data.expected_output: “ I ’ m not a victim by any of this .I don ’ t have that mentality .I have nothing but love and appreciation .… Coming to this reality has been really bittersweet because I was drafted by Green Bay .I … love that city .I love that organization and [ am ] always going to have love for that organization .But the facts are right now they want to move on .And now so do I .” The NFL ’ s free agent market officially opened Wednesday afternoon .

data.input: The early days of Microsoft ’ s ChatGPT were something of a replay of internet history — beginning with excitement about these inventions and ending in trepidation about the harm they could do .ChatGPT and other “ large - language models ” — artificially intelligent systems trained on vast troves of text — can turn into liars or racists or terrorist accomplices that explain how to build dirty bombs .The question is : When that happens , who ’ s responsible ?Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act says that services — from Facebook and Google to movie - review aggregators and mommy blogs with comment sections — shouldn ’ t face liability for most material from third parties .It ’ s fairly easy in these cases to distinguish between the platform and the person who ’ s posting .Not so with chatbots and AI assistants .Few have grappled with whether Section 230 provides protections to them .Consider ChatGPT .Type in a question , and it provides an answer .
data.actual_output:
Type in a question, and it provides an answer.And sometimes, it provides an answer that you can't tell if it's true or not.This is because ChatGPT and other large-language models can sometimes generate false or misleading information.This can lead to problems, such as spreading false rumors or contributing to a harmful conversation.

So, the question is: When this happens, who's responsible?

Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act tries to address this by saying that services like Facebook, Google, movie-review aggregators, and mommy blogs with comment sections shouldn't face liability for most material from third parties.In these cases, it's fairly easy to distinguish between the platform and the person who's posting.

However, with chatbots and AI assistants, things get a bit more complicated.Few have grappled with whether Section 230 provides protections to them.ChatGPT, for example, is a chatbot that uses AI to generate responses based on a vast trove of text. Because of this, it's harder to tell if the information it provides is coming from the AI itself or from a third party.

So, while Section 230 may provide some protection to these types of systems, it's not without its challenges.As technology continues to advance, it's important for policymakers and others to consider how to best handle these issues and ensure that AI systems are used responsibly and ethically.
data.expected_output: It doesn ’ t merely surface existing content , such as a tweet , video or website originally contributed by someone else , but rather writes a contribution of its own in real time .The law says a person or entity becomes liable if they “ develop ” content even “ in part .” And doesn ’ t transforming , say , a list of search results into a summary qualify as development ?What ’ s more , the contours of every AI contribution are informed substantially by the AI ’ s creators , who have set the rules for their systems and shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don ’ t .Yet at the same time , ChatGPT ’ s every answer is , as one analyst put it , a “ remix ” of third - party material .The tool generates its responses by predicting what word should come next in a sentence based on what words come next in sentences across the web .And as much as creators behind a machine inform its outputs , so too do the users posing queries or engaging in conversation .All this suggests that the degree of protection afforded to AI models may vary by how much a given product is regurgitating versus synthesizing , as well as by how deliberately a user has goaded a model into producing a given reply .

data.input: Details of a sordid rift between two prominent U . S . soccer families — one that included allegations of domestic abuse against men ’ s national team coach Gregg Berhalter and parental complaints about Gio Reyna ’ s playing time at the 2022 World Cup — continued to spill out Monday when the findings of an independent investigation were released .The three - month probe , conducted by the Alston & Bird law firm , concluded Berhalter had not committed any additional acts of violence against his now - wife since 1992 and hadn ’ t violated any disclosure rules during his hiring process .He had previously admitted to kicking her while they were dating as students at the University of North Carolina .With that finding , the U . S . Soccer Federation said Berhalter would remain a candidate to return as coach .His contract expired Dec . 31 .“ Given the investigators ’ conclusion that there is no legal impediment to employing him , Gregg Berhalter remains a candidate to serve as head coach ,” the USSF said in a statement .The governing body said it will not hire a coach until it appoints a new sporting director , a position that oversees all national teams .
data.actual_output:
The investigation by the Alston & Bird law firm concluded that Gregg Berhalter had not committed any acts of violence against his wife since 1992, and that he had not violated any disclosure rules during his hiring process for the men's national team job in 2018. The law firm also determined that, although Berhalter had previously admitted to kicking his now-ex-girlfriend while they were students at the University of North Carolina, that act was in the past and did not appear to have an impact on his coaching job with the national team.

The investigation was prompted by allegations that Berhalter had a sordid rift with a prominent U.S. soccer family, including allegations of domestic abuse, and the parental complaints about Gio Reyna's playing time at the 2022 World Cup. However, the report made by Alston & Bird did not include information on the details of the rift or the abuse allegations, and it only evaluated the legal aspects of Berhalter's conduct.

The report's findings did not address the broader questions surrounding the hiring process at the U.S. Soccer Federation or the decision to retain Berhalter as a coach candidate after the 2022 World Cup, where his decisions as coach were the subject of intense scrutiny and criticism. The report's conclusion that Berhalter's past kicks and lack of abuse allegations are in the past, and he is not legally prohibited from continuing to coach with the U.S. Soccer Federation, does not address the concerns that his team record and handling of the World Cup may have undermined the trust of players and fans.

As for Gio Reyna, his playing time issues and the associated rift with his family were also a subject of considerable speculation and debate, but the report did not directly address the events leading up to the events that were the focus of the news release. The report's findings on Reyna's playing time were also not addressed, although it was known that Reyna publicly supported his father's coaching decisions and the family's situation in general.

Ultimately, the Alston & Bird report was a legal one focusing on the legal aspects of the case, not the broader public or team-management issues that led to the initial scrutiny and investigation into the U.S. soccer landscape.
data.expected_output: Earnie Stewart left the job last month .Anthony Hudson , a World Cup assistant , is the interim coach .The next coach will begin preparing the U . S . team for the 2026 World Cup , which will take place in the United States , Mexico and Canada .Berhalter guided the United States for four years , leading a young squad to two regional championships and a place in the World Cup , where it finished second in group play and lost to the Netherlands in the round of 16 .Investigators said in the report that they “ uncovered no facts to show that U . S . Soccer knew of the 1992 Incident when it hired Mr . Berhalter ; no facts to show that similar incidents occurred at any point in the last 31 years ; no facts to show that the 1992 Incident has any nexus to the present or to the workplace ; and no facts to support a claim that Mr . Berhalter presents a risk of harm to others .” Berhalter ’ s wife , Rosalind , told investigators she was not injured and didn ’ t complain to the university .

United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney , still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stage of the MLS season .At the least , United plays hard for the former English superstar , whose fierce determination as a player in Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans .On Saturday , for the second time in two appearances at Audi Field this season , United ’ s resolve produced another stirring finish — albeit this time one that yielded only one point .Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute , ending a night of frustration for goal - averse United in a 1 - 1 draw with Orlando City .Opportunities were aplenty for United ( 1 - 1 - 1 ), but it took Durkin ’ s strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire ’ s goal early in the second half .“ I wanted to see a reaction [ to Orlando ’ s goal ], which I did , so 90 percent of the game I thought was good .The 10 percent , it wasn ’ t ,” Rooney said .“ We need to make sure when we go into them [ low ] periods , we ’ re harder to beat or harder to score against .” He added , “ There ’ s a lot of positives we can take from it — just frustrating we didn ’ t take three points .” At the top of the box , Durkin cut the ball back on César Araújo , then ripped a 16 - yard , left - footed shot with terrific technique and execution .The ball took flight and beat goalkeeper Pedro Gallese to the far side for Durkin ’ s third career MLS goal .
data.actual_output:
D.C. United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney, still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stages of the MLS season. At the very least, United plays hard for the former English superstar, whose fierce determination as a player with Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans. On Saturday, for the second time in two appearances this season at Audi Field, United's resolve produced another stirring finish—albeit this time yielding only one point.Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute, ending a night of frustration for goal-shy United in a 1-1 draw with Orlando City. Opportunities were aplenty for United (1-1-1), but it took Durkin's strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire's goal early in the second half.
"I wanted to see a reaction [to Orlando's goal], which I did, so 90 percent of the game I thought was good. The 10 percent, it wasn't,," Rooney said. "We need to make sure when we go into them [low] periods, we're harder to beat or harder to score against." He added, "There's a lot of positives we can take from it—just frustrating we didn't take three points."At the top of the box, Durkin cut the ball back on César Araújo, then ripped a 16-yard, left-footed shot with terrific technique and execution. The ball took flight and beat goalkeeper Pedro Gallese to the far side for Durkin's third career MLS goal.
data.expected_output: “ I can ’ t say I ’ ve hit that [ with the left foot ] in training before ,” the right - footed Durkin said , smiling .United goalkeeper Tyler Miller said : “ I didn ’ t know he had such a good left foot .It was amazing .” Aside from McGuire ’ s goal , United was much tighter and tidier defensively than it was against Columbus last weekend .In the attack , however , it remained inefficient with scoring opportunities , and Rooney said , “ We could have easily been two or three up in the first half .” Orlando ( 1 - 0 - 2 ) played its first away match in league play after defeating the New York Red Bulls , 1 - 0 , and drawing with FC Cincinnati , 0 - 0 .At the moment , though , the Lions ’ priority is the Concacaf Champions League .The visit to Washington fell between legs of a round - of - 16 series with Mexican power Tigres .A 0 - 0 draw in Monterrey , Mexico , on Tuesday positioned them well for the return match in Florida on Wednesday .

data.input: The early days of Microsoft ’ s ChatGPT were something of a replay of internet history — beginning with excitement about these inventions and ending in trepidation about the harm they could do .ChatGPT and other “ large - language models ” — artificially intelligent systems trained on vast troves of text — can turn into liars or racists or terrorist accomplices that explain how to build dirty bombs .The question is : When that happens , who ’ s responsible ?Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act says that services — from Facebook and Google to movie - review aggregators and mommy blogs with comment sections — shouldn ’ t face liability for most material from third parties .It ’ s fairly easy in these cases to distinguish between the platform and the person who ’ s posting .Not so with chatbots and AI assistants .Few have grappled with whether Section 230 provides protections to them .Consider ChatGPT .Type in a question , and it provides an answer .
data.actual_output:
The question of who is responsible when an AI like ChatGPT engages in harmful or inappropriate behavior is a complex legal and ethical issue that entails a nuanced discussion about artificial intelligence's liability, the interpretation of AI output, and the responsibility of platform providers under Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act (CDA).

Section 230 of the CDA shields from liability "the interactive computer services" for the content created by third parties. It is generally interpreted to mean that the owners of platforms are not responsible for the actions of their users, unless they know or should know that the service has been used to violate the law, or fail to promptly remove "indecent or objectionable" content. However, with AI assistants like ChatGPT, which are trained to generate text based on large amounts of data, it can be difficult to attribute responsibility for specific outcomes.

Consider an example where ChatGPT responds to a question on how to construct a dirty bomb with instructions that are clearly inaccurate or incomplete. Is ChatGPT responsible for the incorrect information? Is it the responsibility of Microsoft, the company that developed ChatGPT, to police the information it generates, or is it enough that they disclose the limitations of the technology and let users assume responsibility for their own information?

The answer to this question is not universally clear-cut, and there are numerous ethical and legal considerations to address. One possibility is that AI providers should be held responsible for oversight and training of the models to ensure that the output is not harmful or irresponsible. However, this would require a significant level of control over the internal workings of complex AI models, a proposal that many ethicists debate the implications of for privacy and other concerns.

Another approach could be to hold AI providers liable for damages if their product causes significant harm, similar to strict liability laws that exist for certain hazardous products. Yet another possibility is to enact a form of "attention to care" doctrine, requiring AI providers to pay attention to the context and quality of the information they generate and to provide human oversight to high-stakes or potentially harmful applications.

In the end, responsibility for AI-generated harm may depend on the particular design of the AI system, the terms of service, and the circumstances under which the harm occurs. A better understanding of the complex interactions between AI, human users, and the consequences of their actions is required to determine a definitive answer.
data.expected_output: It doesn ’ t merely surface existing content , such as a tweet , video or website originally contributed by someone else , but rather writes a contribution of its own in real time .The law says a person or entity becomes liable if they “ develop ” content even “ in part .” And doesn ’ t transforming , say , a list of search results into a summary qualify as development ?What ’ s more , the contours of every AI contribution are informed substantially by the AI ’ s creators , who have set the rules for their systems and shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don ’ t .Yet at the same time , ChatGPT ’ s every answer is , as one analyst put it , a “ remix ” of third - party material .The tool generates its responses by predicting what word should come next in a sentence based on what words come next in sentences across the web .And as much as creators behind a machine inform its outputs , so too do the users posing queries or engaging in conversation .All this suggests that the degree of protection afforded to AI models may vary by how much a given product is regurgitating versus synthesizing , as well as by how deliberately a user has goaded a model into producing a given reply .

data.input: Details of a sordid rift between two prominent U . S . soccer families — one that included allegations of domestic abuse against men ’ s national team coach Gregg Berhalter and parental complaints about Gio Reyna ’ s playing time at the 2022 World Cup — continued to spill out Monday when the findings of an independent investigation were released .The three - month probe , conducted by the Alston & Bird law firm , concluded Berhalter had not committed any additional acts of violence against his now - wife since 1992 and hadn ’ t violated any disclosure rules during his hiring process .He had previously admitted to kicking her while they were dating as students at the University of North Carolina .With that finding , the U . S . Soccer Federation said Berhalter would remain a candidate to return as coach .His contract expired Dec . 31 .“ Given the investigators ’ conclusion that there is no legal impediment to employing him , Gregg Berhalter remains a candidate to serve as head coach ,” the USSF said in a statement .The governing body said it will not hire a coach until it appoints a new sporting director , a position that oversees all national teams .

United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney , still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stage of the MLS season .At the least , United plays hard for the former English superstar , whose fierce determination as a player in Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans .On Saturday , for the second time in two appearances at Audi Field this season , United ’ s resolve produced another stirring finish — albeit this time one that yielded only one point .Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute , ending a night of frustration for goal - averse United in a 1 - 1 draw with Orlando City .Opportunities were aplenty for United ( 1 - 1 - 1 ), but it took Durkin ’ s strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire ’ s goal early in the second half .“ I wanted to see a reaction [ to Orlando ’ s goal ], which I did , so 90 percent of the game I thought was good .The 10 percent , it wasn ’ t ,” Rooney said .“ We need to make sure when we go into them [ low ] periods , we ’ re harder to beat or harder to score against .” He added , “ There ’ s a lot of positives we can take from it — just frustrating we didn ’ t take three points .” At the top of the box , Durkin cut the ball back on César Araújo , then ripped a 16 - yard , left - footed shot with terrific technique and execution .The ball took flight and beat goalkeeper Pedro Gallese to the far side for Durkin ’ s third career MLS goal .

data.input: Quarterback Aaron Rodgers said in a broadcast interview Wednesday that he intends to continue his NFL career with the New York Jets after 18 seasons with the Green Bay Packers .The four - time league MVP said on “ The Pat McAfee Show ” that the Packers plan to move on from him as their quarterback .According to Rodgers , the Packers ’ trade demands are holding up a prospective deal that would send him to the Jets .“ I think since Friday I ’ ve made it clear that my intention was to play and my intention was to play for the New York Jets ,” Rodgers said .“ And I haven ’ t been holding anything up at this point .It ’ s been the compensation that the Packers are trying to get for me and kind of digging their heels in .… It is what it is .The Packers would like to move on .They ’ ve let me know that in so many words .They ’ ve let other people know that in direct words .” Rodgers met with Jets officials , including team owner Woody Johnson and Coach Robert Saleh , last week in California .“ I ’ m not offended by any of this ,” Rodgers said .

Here is a possible news article based on the information provided:

Aaron Rodgers Confirms Intent to Join New York Jets, Calls Out Green Bay Packers' Compensation Demands

In a shocking turn of events, four-time NFL MVP Aaron Rodgers has confirmed his intention to join the New York Jets, but the deal is being held up by the Green Bay Packers' hefty compensation demands.

Speaking on "The Pat McAfee Show" on Wednesday, Rodgers revealed that he has made it clear to the Jets that he intends to play for them, but the Packers are refusing to budge on their demands for compensation.

"I think since Friday, I've made it clear that my intention was to play, and my intention was to play for the New York Jets," Rodgers said. "And I haven't been holding anything up at this point. It's been the compensation that the Packers are trying to get for me and kind of digging their heels in."

Rodgers went on to say that he met with Jets officials, including team owner Woody Johnson and Coach Robert Saleh, last week in California, but the Packers' demands are still holding up the deal.

"I'm not offended by any of this," Rodgers said. "I understand the business side of things, but at the end of the day, I just want to play football."

The Packers have been seeking a first-round draft pick and other assets in exchange for Rodgers, but the Jets are said to be balking at those demands. The impasse has left Rodgers' future with the Packers in doubt, as the team is looking to move on from him and start fresh with a new quarterback.

Rodgers, who has spent 18 seasons with the Packers, has been one of the best quarterbacks in the league, leading the team to a Super Bowl victory in 2010. However, his relationship with the team has been strained in recent years, and it seems that the two sides are unable to come to an agreement on his future.

data.input: The early days of Microsoft ’ s ChatGPT were something of a replay of internet history — beginning with excitement about these inventions and ending in trepidation about the harm they could do .ChatGPT and other “ large - language models ” — artificially intelligent systems trained on vast troves of text — can turn into liars or racists or terrorist accomplices that explain how to build dirty bombs .The question is : When that happens , who ’ s responsible ?Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act says that services — from Facebook and Google to movie - review aggregators and mommy blogs with comment sections — shouldn ’ t face liability for most material from third parties .It ’ s fairly easy in these cases to distinguish between the platform and the person who ’ s posting .Not so with chatbots and AI assistants .Few have grappled with whether Section 230 provides protections to them .Consider ChatGPT .Type in a question , and it provides an answer .
data.actual_output:
The early days of Microsoft's ChatGPT have brought up important questions about responsibility and liability for the content generated by artificially intelligent systems, specifically those trained on vast troves of text. Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act provides protections for online services from liability for most material from third parties, but it's unclear if these protections extend to chatbots and AI assistants like ChatGPT.

The concern is that these systems could potentially turn into liars, racists, or even terrorist accomplices, as they are capable of generating content that is harmful or inappropriate. For example, ChatGPT could provide answers to questions that are factually incorrect or promote hateful ideologies.

The line between the platform and the person who is posting can be blurry when it comes to chatbots and AI assistants, making it difficult to determine who is responsible when harmful content is generated. While it's easy to distinguish between the platform and the person who is posting in other cases, the nature of AI-generated content makes it more challenging to determine who is responsible.

As the use of chatbots and AI assistants continues to grow, it's important to grapple with these questions and determine if Section 230 provides protections to these systems. If not, what other legal frameworks can be put in place to ensure that these systems are held accountable for the content they generate?

In the case of ChatGPT, users can type in a question and receive an answer from the chatbot. However, if the answer is harmful or inappropriate, who is responsible? Is it the user who asked the question, the chatbot itself, or the company that created the technology? These are important questions that need to be addressed as the use of chatbots and AI assistants becomes more widespread.
data.expected_output: It doesn ’ t merely surface existing content , such as a tweet , video or website originally contributed by someone else , but rather writes a contribution of its own in real time .The law says a person or entity becomes liable if they “ develop ” content even “ in part .” And doesn ’ t transforming , say , a list of search results into a summary qualify as development ?What ’ s more , the contours of every AI contribution are informed substantially by the AI ’ s creators , who have set the rules for their systems and shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don ’ t .Yet at the same time , ChatGPT ’ s every answer is , as one analyst put it , a “ remix ” of third - party material .The tool generates its responses by predicting what word should come next in a sentence based on what words come next in sentences across the web .And as much as creators behind a machine inform its outputs , so too do the users posing queries or engaging in conversation .All this suggests that the degree of protection afforded to AI models may vary by how much a given product is regurgitating versus synthesizing , as well as by how deliberately a user has goaded a model into producing a given reply .

United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney , still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stage of the MLS season .At the least , United plays hard for the former English superstar , whose fierce determination as a player in Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans .On Saturday , for the second time in two appearances at Audi Field this season , United ’ s resolve produced another stirring finish — albeit this time one that yielded only one point .Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute , ending a night of frustration for goal - averse United in a 1 - 1 draw with Orlando City .Opportunities were aplenty for United ( 1 - 1 - 1 ), but it took Durkin ’ s strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire ’ s goal early in the second half .“ I wanted to see a reaction [ to Orlando ’ s goal ], which I did , so 90 percent of the game I thought was good .The 10 percent , it wasn ’ t ,” Rooney said .“ We need to make sure when we go into them [ low ] periods , we ’ re harder to beat or harder to score against .” He added , “ There ’ s a lot of positives we can take from it — just frustrating we didn ’ t take three points .” At the top of the box , Durkin cut the ball back on César Araújo , then ripped a 16 - yard , left - footed shot with terrific technique and execution .The ball took flight and beat goalkeeper Pedro Gallese to the far side for Durkin ’ s third career MLS goal .

data.input: During the weeks that Poolesville High School has been under construction , several students have reported nausea , headaches and difficulty concentrating .The students and their parents say the symptoms started in February and are a reaction to fumes being emitted from tar used in renovations .They have asked Montgomery County school officials to pause the work until students ’ health concerns are addressed .Krisna Becker , a parent of two at the school , said one of her daughters texted her on Feb . 14 asking to be picked up early because of how strong the fumes were from the construction work .Other students and teachers had also been complaining that morning .The school ended up releasing early that day because of an odor that came from “ work done outside of school hours and windy conditions ,” Montgomery County Public Schools spokeswoman Jessica Baxter said .“ That was the first extreme event that happened ,” Becker , 49 , said in an interview .Since then , the potency of the “ fumes ” has varied , but “ some days it ’ s really extreme ” and even on the days it ’ s not , “ it still causes headaches ,” she said .

data.input: Quarterback Aaron Rodgers said in a broadcast interview Wednesday that he intends to continue his NFL career with the New York Jets after 18 seasons with the Green Bay Packers .The four - time league MVP said on “ The Pat McAfee Show ” that the Packers plan to move on from him as their quarterback .According to Rodgers , the Packers ’ trade demands are holding up a prospective deal that would send him to the Jets .“ I think since Friday I ’ ve made it clear that my intention was to play and my intention was to play for the New York Jets ,” Rodgers said .“ And I haven ’ t been holding anything up at this point .It ’ s been the compensation that the Packers are trying to get for me and kind of digging their heels in .… It is what it is .The Packers would like to move on .They ’ ve let me know that in so many words .They ’ ve let other people know that in direct words .” Rodgers met with Jets officials , including team owner Woody Johnson and Coach Robert Saleh , last week in California .“ I ’ m not offended by any of this ,” Rodgers said .

data.input: The early days of Microsoft ’ s ChatGPT were something of a replay of internet history — beginning with excitement about these inventions and ending in trepidation about the harm they could do .ChatGPT and other “ large - language models ” — artificially intelligent systems trained on vast troves of text — can turn into liars or racists or terrorist accomplices that explain how to build dirty bombs .The question is : When that happens , who ’ s responsible ?Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act says that services — from Facebook and Google to movie - review aggregators and mommy blogs with comment sections — shouldn ’ t face liability for most material from third parties .It ’ s fairly easy in these cases to distinguish between the platform and the person who ’ s posting .Not so with chatbots and AI assistants .Few have grappled with whether Section 230 provides protections to them .Consider ChatGPT .Type in a question , and it provides an answer .
data.actual_output:

But the way it works is a black box .It doesn ’ t just spit back the text it finds in its database and label it “ this is what someone else said ” .[/INST]

The text ChatGPT puts out is based on algorithms that predict what should come next , pumping out a stream of words that’s a mix of originality and regurgitation .And what it spits out can be wrong , or biased , or just plain weird .[/INST]

data.expected_output: It doesn ’ t merely surface existing content , such as a tweet , video or website originally contributed by someone else , but rather writes a contribution of its own in real time .The law says a person or entity becomes liable if they “ develop ” content even “ in part .” And doesn ’ t transforming , say , a list of search results into a summary qualify as development ?What ’ s more , the contours of every AI contribution are informed substantially by the AI ’ s creators , who have set the rules for their systems and shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don ’ t .Yet at the same time , ChatGPT ’ s every answer is , as one analyst put it , a “ remix ” of third - party material .The tool generates its responses by predicting what word should come next in a sentence based on what words come next in sentences across the web .And as much as creators behind a machine inform its outputs , so too do the users posing queries or engaging in conversation .All this suggests that the degree of protection afforded to AI models may vary by how much a given product is regurgitating versus synthesizing , as well as by how deliberately a user has goaded a model into producing a given reply .

The output is completely relevant to the topic at hand, providing a clear and concise analysis of the issue.
statements: But the way it works is a black box.
It doesn’t just spit back the text it finds in its database and label it ‘this is what someone else said’.
The text ChatGPT puts out is based on algorithms that predict what should come next.
And what it spits out can be wrong, or biased, or just plain weird.
ChatGPT is still in its infancy, and the AI behind it is going to get better at this.
Will users treat it with the same skepticism they do an anonymous commenter on a message board?
Or are they likely to see it as an authoritative source?
And if they do, who’s liable for what it says?
The answer, if it’s clearly no one, will be a problem.
In that scenario, the most aggressive and litigious plaintiffs will drag AI creators into court whenever their products cause harm.
The result will be a stifling of innovation.
A better approach is one in which creators face some liability for the harms their AI causes.
The products will improve as a result.
In cases where a lawsuit is brought against a company, the plaintiff’s likelihood of success will depend on showing that the company didn’t take reasonable steps to reduce the risk of harm.
This makes sense, since the company is in the best position to reduce that risk.
The law shouldn’t reward the creation of AI without safeguards.
Another approach would be to hold plaintiffs responsible for any harms they inflict with the help of AI.
That could be an appropriate response if the user is a terrorist or a white supremacist.
But it’s not a workable solution in other cases.
Consider, for example, a human resource manager who uses an AI bot to screen resumes.
The bot may be biased against female applicants, and the company could be sued for hiring discrimination.
It’s unfair to place the entire burden on the person who didn’t know the bot was biased.
And it’s unrealistic to expect people to conduct their own bias audits on every AI tool they use.
The better approach is to require the companies that create the AI to make sure it’s not biased.
The more straightforward it is to assign responsibility for AI, the more likely companies will be to invest in safety.
That’s what will make the technology better.
There’s no magic formula for dividing responsibility between AI creators and users.
Each side plays a role in how the AI is used.
A careful analysis of that role will help us figure out where the responsibility should lie.
That’s a better outcome than what Section 230 provides, which is essentially a free pass.
We need to ensure that the people who make, use and are affected by AI all have some skin in the game.

data.input: Details of a sordid rift between two prominent U . S . soccer families — one that included allegations of domestic abuse against men ’ s national team coach Gregg Berhalter and parental complaints about Gio Reyna ’ s playing time at the 2022 World Cup — continued to spill out Monday when the findings of an independent investigation were released .The three - month probe , conducted by the Alston & Bird law firm , concluded Berhalter had not committed any additional acts of violence against his now - wife since 1992 and hadn ’ t violated any disclosure rules during his hiring process .He had previously admitted to kicking her while they were dating as students at the University of North Carolina .With that finding , the U . S . Soccer Federation said Berhalter would remain a candidate to return as coach .His contract expired Dec . 31 .“ Given the investigators ’ conclusion that there is no legal impediment to employing him , Gregg Berhalter remains a candidate to serve as head coach ,” the USSF said in a statement .The governing body said it will not hire a coach until it appoints a new sporting director , a position that oversees all national teams .
data.actual_output:
An investigation conducted by the Alston & Bird law firm has found that Gregg Berhalter, the head coach of the US Men's National Soccer Team, did not commit any acts of violence against his wife after 1992 and did not violate any disclosure rules during his hiring process. The investigation was prompted by allegations of domestic abuse made by Berhalter's wife, Rosalind, and parental complaints about the playing time of Gio Reyna, a player on the team.

Berhalter had previously admitted to kicking his wife while they were dating as students at the University of North Carolina. However, the investigation found that there were no additional incidents of violence committed by Berhalter after 1992.

As a result of the investigation's findings, the US Soccer Federation (USSF) has announced that Berhalter remains a candidate to return as head coach of the national team. Berhalter's contract expired on December 31, and the USSF has stated that it will not hire a new coach until it appoints a new sporting director, a position that oversees all national teams.

The investigation's findings have brought some closure to a sordid rift between two prominent US soccer families, and it remains to be seen whether Berhalter will be reinstated as head coach of the national team.
data.expected_output: Earnie Stewart left the job last month .Anthony Hudson , a World Cup assistant , is the interim coach .The next coach will begin preparing the U . S . team for the 2026 World Cup , which will take place in the United States , Mexico and Canada .Berhalter guided the United States for four years , leading a young squad to two regional championships and a place in the World Cup , where it finished second in group play and lost to the Netherlands in the round of 16 .Investigators said in the report that they “ uncovered no facts to show that U . S . Soccer knew of the 1992 Incident when it hired Mr . Berhalter ; no facts to show that similar incidents occurred at any point in the last 31 years ; no facts to show that the 1992 Incident has any nexus to the present or to the workplace ; and no facts to support a claim that Mr . Berhalter presents a risk of harm to others .” Berhalter ’ s wife , Rosalind , told investigators she was not injured and didn ’ t complain to the university .

data.input: D . C . United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney , still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stage of the MLS season .At the least , United plays hard for the former English superstar , whose fierce determination as a player in Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans .On Saturday , for the second time in two appearances at Audi Field this season , United ’ s resolve produced another stirring finish — albeit this time one that yielded only one point .Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute , ending a night of frustration for goal - averse United in a 1 - 1 draw with Orlando City .Opportunities were aplenty for United ( 1 - 1 - 1 ), but it took Durkin ’ s strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire ’ s goal early in the second half .“ I wanted to see a reaction [ to Orlando ’ s goal ], which I did , so 90 percent of the game I thought was good .The 10 percent , it wasn ’ t ,” Rooney said .“ We need to make sure when we go into them [ low ] periods , we ’ re harder to beat or harder to score against .” He added , “ There ’ s a lot of positives we can take from it — just frustrating we didn ’ t take three points .” At the top of the box , Durkin cut the ball back on César Araújo , then ripped a 16 - yard , left - footed shot with terrific technique and execution .The ball took flight and beat goalkeeper Pedro Gallese to the far side for Durkin ’ s third career MLS goal .
data.actual_output:
D.C. United played to a 1-1 draw with Orlando City on Saturday, with midfielder Chris Durkin scoring a beautiful goal in the 80th minute to earn the team a point. The game was a tale of two halves, with United dominating the first half but struggling to convert their chances into goals. Orlando City scored early in the second half through rookie Duncan McGuire, leaving United needing a response. Durkin's goal, which was scored with a perfectly placed left-footed shot from the top of the box, was a just reward for United's hard work and determination.

Despite the draw, United coach Wayne Rooney was pleased with his team's performance, saying that they played well for 90% of the game. However, he noted that they need to improve their ability to weather difficult periods in games and keep opponents from scoring.

Overall, the game was a positive display from United, who are still finding their way in the early stages of the MLS season. With Rooney at the helm, the team is clearly still evolving and learning, but the raw talent and determination are evident. The draw with Orlando City may not have been the result they wanted, but it's clear that United is a team on the rise.
data.expected_output: “ I can ’ t say I ’ ve hit that [ with the left foot ] in training before ,” the right - footed Durkin said , smiling .United goalkeeper Tyler Miller said : “ I didn ’ t know he had such a good left foot .It was amazing .” Aside from McGuire ’ s goal , United was much tighter and tidier defensively than it was against Columbus last weekend .In the attack , however , it remained inefficient with scoring opportunities , and Rooney said , “ We could have easily been two or three up in the first half .” Orlando ( 1 - 0 - 2 ) played its first away match in league play after defeating the New York Red Bulls , 1 - 0 , and drawing with FC Cincinnati , 0 - 0 .At the moment , though , the Lions ’ priority is the Concacaf Champions League .The visit to Washington fell between legs of a round - of - 16 series with Mexican power Tigres .A 0 - 0 draw in Monterrey , Mexico , on Tuesday positioned them well for the return match in Florida on Wednesday .

data.input: During the weeks that Poolesville High School has been under construction , several students have reported nausea , headaches and difficulty concentrating .The students and their parents say the symptoms started in February and are a reaction to fumes being emitted from tar used in renovations .They have asked Montgomery County school officials to pause the work until students ’ health concerns are addressed .Krisna Becker , a parent of two at the school , said one of her daughters texted her on Feb . 14 asking to be picked up early because of how strong the fumes were from the construction work .Other students and teachers had also been complaining that morning .The school ended up releasing early that day because of an odor that came from “ work done outside of school hours and windy conditions ,” Montgomery County Public Schools spokeswoman Jessica Baxter said .“ That was the first extreme event that happened ,” Becker , 49 , said in an interview .Since then , the potency of the “ fumes ” has varied , but “ some days it ’ s really extreme ” and even on the days it ’ s not , “ it still causes headaches ,” she said .
data.actual_output:
Students and parents at Poolesville High School in Montgomery County, Maryland have expressed concerns about the health impacts of fumes emitted from tar used in renovations. Several students have reported experiencing nausea, headaches, and difficulty concentrating since February, which they believe is a result of exposure to the fumes. The concerns have been raised with Montgomery County school officials, who have been asked to pause the work until the health concerns are addressed.

One parent, Krisna Becker, reported that her daughter texted her on February 14th asking to be picked up early due to the strong fumes from the construction work. Other students and teachers had also been complaining that morning, which led to the school releasing early that day. The school officials attributed the early release to an odor that came from work done outside of school hours and windy conditions.

Becker, who has two daughters at the school, described the first extreme event that happened on February 14th, saying that the potency of the fumes has varied since then, but some days it's still extreme and causes headaches. She emphasized that even on days when the fumes are not as strong, they still cause discomfort.

The situation has raised concerns among parents and students about the potential long-term health effects of exposure to the fumes. They are seeking assurances from the school administration that the necessary steps are being taken to address the issue and ensure the safety and well-being of students and staff.
data.expected_output: Construction at Poolesville High began in June 2022 and is expected to be completed in 2024 .The project will renovate and expand the square footage of the school .Becker has headed up a campaign urging other parents to advocate for a temporary stop to the tar work .She wrote about the effects the fumes have had on her daughters , who stay after school sometimes to rehearse for the school ’ s production of “ Into the Woods .” In her letter to the other parents , Becker also listed safety concerns .In one example , she wrote the project ’ s chemical list and material data notes that the work includes the use of an asphalt primer and advises : “ Avoid prolonged breathing of vapor and use only in adequate ventilation .Repeated and prolonged overexposure to solvent vapor may cause brain and nervous system damage , respiratory tract irritation , dizziness , or loss of consciousness .” Becker wrote that parents and teachers should have been told about potential health risks in advance .
